blog.name: thisselflovecamebacktome
blog.title: In wildest dreams I never dreamed of this...

summary: My top 5 hopes for TS7
title: My top 5 hopes for TS7
body:
I typically hate making theory posts because lets face it, the last time I made one was before 1989 came out and I basically predicted it would be Reputation…. so was I ahead of my time or just completely off the ball? The world will never know. So instead, I’m just going to put a few thoughts on what I would love to see on Taylor’s next album.

1. More female influence. As much as I think most of the songs Taylor has done with Jack, Martin and Shellback are bops, and as much as I understand the logic of ‘why fix what isn’t broken?’, I truly do hope that a larger percentage of this album has female collaborations, whether they be writing, producing or singing wise. Specifically, now that they’re on the same label, it would be incredible to have a song cowritten or cosung by Lorde or Florence.

2. A “relapse” song of sorts. I don’t want to take away from the fact it appears Taylor is at peace with her life right now because I truly believe she is. But to be honest, I would really love a song based on a moment like the woods one the other day or when news outlets were saying that the Reputation tour was going to be a flop where, even for just a moment, she doubted the choices she made or had a ‘here we go again’ moment. Basically I just want a song showing that the road to happiness isn’t just a straight line. I also wouldn’t mind if this song was like Call It What You Want where she realises that the love she has around her helps calm her nervous tendencies.

3. Positive and “negative” friendship songs. I don’t want the whole Kimye thing and how her “friends” turned on her rehashed, but it would be good to hear about how large changes in her life such as stepping out of the spotlight shaped her friendships. Like what challenges did it bring that she suddenly couldn’t see her famous friends as easily due to the paparazzi? Did not being able to attend events with them put strain on their friendship? And alternatively, how incredible was it making friends with people like Joe’s brother (I mention him specifically because his name was on the LWYMMD tshirt) and knowing you could trust them not to reveal her location and other secrets? What was it like making the same type of friendships the everyday person has (not saying her famous ones aren’t genuine, but they’d come with different challenges than typical ones) for the first time in a long time? Like I don’t know, as much as 1989 wasn’t my favourite album or era, the one thing I did love was the focus on friendship and I’d like to see that come back.

4. More theatre/movie soundtrack sounds. With Taylor doing Cats and how borderline theatre/movie soundtrack like Don’t Blame Me and the tour version of I Did Something Bad were, she has really shown that these kind of elements can work for her and I really hope it’s something she incorporates more.

5. Songs about self love and reflection. This one is almost guaranteed to happen in my opinion given both where she ended the Reputation album and the Elle piece she’s teased at coming out later today. Regardless, I still wanted to say it because in my opinion, Taylor’s songs about self reflection, or even love songs that can be taken that way (This Love, Clean etc) are some of, if not, her best.

blog.name: ellieswiftie7
blog.title: ✨ellie✨
blog.description: just your average 23 year old fan girling over taylor swift

summary: So, @taylorswift- funny story behind this photo.... I made my friend Dan wait in line for 8 hours and miss his friends BABY...
caption:
So, @taylorswift- funny story behind this photo…. I made my friend Dan wait in line for 8 hours and miss his friends BABY SHOWER, like I literally begged him, all the while convincing him it was the best way to get to the front of the mosh… then we got inside and it was ASSIGNED SEATING ! hahahaha oh my god I’ve never laughed so much in my life, Dan honest to god nearly killed me. However, it turned out to be one of the most fun the both of us have ever had in our existence !!! 

I ALSO love this pic because it’s when I was free from my binge eating disorder (only in literally the previous week had I developed a healthy relationship with food again). I started to love myself and what I looked like and was becoming so much more confident being me. “New Romantics” is a song I listened to OVER AND OVER during this hard time, specifically the lyric “I could build a castle, with all the bricks they threw at me” and honestly look at me!! Finally happy in my own castle. This is why the 1989 era is still my personal favourite era. 

thank you so much for helping me heal <3

blog.name: till-somebodylosestheirmind
blog.title: Kayla
blog.description:
Team: I touched Taylor Swift’s hand but she has no idea who I am.

💗💗💗💗💗💗💗

summary:
WHAT WE KNOW -
1.  This was posted 283 days before her birthday.
2.  2+8+3=13.
3.  @taylorswift was born on the 13th.
4.  283...
body:
WHAT WE KNOW -

1. This was posted 283 days before her birthday.

2. 2+8+3=13.

3. @taylorswift was born on the 13th.

4. 283 hours is roughly 12 days.

5. 12 days from when this was posted is St. Patrick’s Day.

6. St. Patrick’s day is the 17th.

7. The guy from “I’d lie” was born on the 17th.

8. “I’d lie” was unreleased.

CONCLUSION - she’s never releasing ts7.

blog.description:
I'm Michelle, I love Taylor Swift. She's helped me through a lot, she's always been the shining light in my darkness and she's made me a stronger and better person.
I've saw Taylor live twice, she's liked an Instagram post of mine before 😱 and I met my wonderful girlfriend thanks to Taylor ❤
I take the most awkward selfies...

taylor swift makes me really, really happy.

..by grace through faith..

[[SEATTLE]]

#swiftsquad | doin' it since 2008

yuh

summary: this is probably one of my favorite videos I took from the Seattle show. We had two ASL artists performing throughout the entire...
body:
soooo who else remembers these amazing ASL interpreters at tour???

this is probably one of my favorite videos I took from the Seattle show. We had two ASL artists performing throughout the entire concert and I thought it was so cool. They were pretty incredible. Like, not ONCE did they waver in enthusiasm, expressiveness, or energy. These ladies were poignant and they PERFORMED. Each and every song throughout the entire 4+ hour show (opening acts included!). I can’t imagine how exhausting that would be!

If you happen to be someone blessed with the ability to hear music (such as myself) it’s natural to initially see this woman and just kind of think to ourselves “oh that’s nice”, and quickly move on. We acknowledge her, sure. However, ultimately it becomes a trivial detail that’s relatively easy to overlook if you’re not impacted by a physical disability.

As humans, we have a tendency to avoid what we do not understand.

Not because we’re heartless assholes, but because it’s not easy or natural to discern or elicit empathy for stuff we don’t “get”.

I’m guilty of this myself. But I’ve also found that by taking a moment to pause and empathize without sympathizing (NOT the same thing!) is incredibly helpful and makes all the difference. These professional ASL linguists were able to give those who are hard of hearing such a BEAUTIFUL GIFT in helping them experience Taylor live in concert, and to deeply connect with her music and emotions. In addition, the attention to detail with the inclusion of the ASL program in turn provides extra comfort in relieving any feelings of exclusion, apprehension, or fear of ostracization a Swiftie may feel as a result of their disability (which in my opinion, is much more important). It’s the best part, because it essentially sends the message of:

“hey, we see you. we care about you! we want you to be comfortable and we REALLY want to make sure you have the time of your life and enjoy the show just like everyone else!”. I’d imagine that the impact that this extra compassionate effort goes far beyond basic "standard accommodations” or “basic convenience” in the eyes of a disabled Swiftie. It likely transcends into something most of us cannot even begin to imagine or comprehend in regards to the significantly more positive difference it makes in the Swiftie’s concert experience from beginning to end.

Alright. OK. Yes, I’m fully aware that I’m rambling (again) and have unintentionally written yet another essay… 😩😂

listen.

i just feel like this is a really important topic that kind of doesn’t get enough attention so i felt compelled to share.

and to give a “slow clap” to Team Taylor for being freakin’ awesome and working so hard and being consistent in their compassion and thoughtful attention detail.

@taylornation (+ crew) we love and appreciate y'all 4 realz💜

*I’m fairly confident that I’m the first person to legitmately use the adjective “bravo!” in a sentence with 100% seriousness since 1952. so there’s that.

love,

crystal

@taylorswift

@taylornation
